# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

In Julia, you can solve this task by using built-in functions like `lowercase`, `strip` and `replace`. 
Here's a function that accomplishes it:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    col = lowercase(col); # Convert to lower case
    col = strip(col);     # Remove leading/trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, " " => "_");  # Replace spaces with underscores
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_");  # Replace hyphens with underscores
    return col;
end
```
This function first converts the input string to lowercase using `lowercase`. Then it removes any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip`. Finally, it replaces all spaces and hyphens in the string with underscores using `replace`. 

You can use this function like so:

```julia
column = "My Column";
cleaned_column = clean_column(column);
print(cleaned_column) # This will print: my_column
```
